gurmukhi: jw kY nwiekw Anyk eyk sy AiDk eyk pUrn suhwg Bwg sauqY sm Dwm hY
transliteration: Jaa Kai Naaikaa Anayk Ayk Say Adhik Ayka , Pooran Suhaag Bhaag Saoutai Sam Dhaam Hai ?
translation: A beloved husband who has many wives and each one better than the other, each one enjoys all the love, attention of husband and other comforts of life.

gurmukhi: mwnn huie mwn BMg ibCur ibdys rhI ibrh ibXog lg ibrhnI Bwm hY
transliteration: Maanan Hui Maan Bhang Bichhur Bidays Rahee , Birah Biyog Lag Birahanee Bhaam Hai ?
translation: Separated from her dear husband and living far away from him, she feels her respect getting compromised, beside bearing the pangs of separation and thus is called separated.

gurmukhi: isQl smwn qRIXw sky n irJwie piRX dXo hY duhwg vY duhwgn snwm hY
transliteration: Sidal Samaan Treeyaa Sakay N Rijhaai Priya , Dayo Hai Duhaag Vai Duhaagan Sanaam Hai ?
translation: Like lazy people, idle wife cannot please her husband and as a result she is known as one who has been abandoned by her husband.

gurmukhi: locn sÍn jIh kr AMg AMghIn prsXo n pyKRXo sunRXo myro khw nwm hY ]642]
transliteration: Lochan Sravan Jeeh Kar Ang Angaheena , Parasayo N Paykhyo Sounyo Mayro Kahaa Naam Hai ?642?
translation: One who enjoys love of her husband is called Suhagan (Happily married). Even separated woman and a Duhagan (unhappy in marriage) also belong to someone and are associated with him, but I have not felt my beloved with any part of my body. I have not seen H
